header: The People of Israel Are Counted

verse: The Lord spoke to Moses in the Meeting Tent [the Tabernacle; Ex. 25–31] in the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Sinai. This was on the first day of the second month in the second year after the Israelites left Egypt [Ex. 12:50–51; one year later]. He said to Moses:

“You and Aaron must ·count [take a census of; lift the head of] all the ·people of Israel [community/congregation/assembly of the sons/children of Israel] by ·families [clans] and family groups, listing the name of each ·man [male].
You and Aaron must count every man twenty years old or older who will serve in the army of Israel, and list them by their divisions [like a military registration].
One man from each tribe, the leader of his family, will help you.
These are the names of the men who will help you:
from the tribe of Simeon—Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;
from the tribe of Judah—Nahshon son of Amminadab;
from the tribe of Issachar—Nethanel son of Zuar;
from the tribe of Zebulun—Eliab son of Helon;
from the tribe of Ephraim son of Joseph—Elishama son of Ammihud;
from the tribe of Benjamin—Abidan son of Gideoni;
from the tribe of Dan—Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;
from the tribe of Asher—Pagiel son of Ocran;
from the tribe of Gad—Eliasaph son of Deuel;
from the tribe of Naphtali—Ahira son of Enan.”
These were the men chosen from the ·people [community; congregation; assembly] to be leaders of their tribes, the heads of Israel’s family groups.
Moses and Aaron took these men ·who had been picked [whose names had been designated]

and ·called [assembled] all the ·people [community; congregation; assembly] of Israel together on the first day of the second month. Then the people ·were listed [registered their genealogies] by their ·families [clans] and family groups, and all the ·men [males] who were twenty years old or older were listed by name.
Moses did exactly what the Lord had commanded and ·listed [enrolled] the people while they were in the ·Desert [Wilderness] of Sinai.

The ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Reuben, the first son born to Israel [Jacob; Gen. 35:23; 46:8; 49:3], ·was counted [according to their records/lineage]; all the men twenty years old or older who were able to serve in the army were listed by name with their ·families [clans] and family groups.
The tribe of Reuben totaled 46,500 men.

The ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Simeon ·was counted [according to their records/lineage]; all the men twenty years old or older who were able to serve in the army were listed by name with their ·families [clans] and family groups.
The tribe of Simeon totaled 59,300 men.

The ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Gad ·was counted [according to their records/lineage]; all the men twenty years old or older who were able to serve in the army were listed by name with their ·families [clans] and family groups.
The tribe of Gad totaled 45,650 men.

The ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Judah ·was counted [according to their records/lineage]; all the men twenty years old or older who were able to serve in the army were listed by name with their ·families [clans] and family groups.
The tribe of Judah totaled 74,600 men.

The ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Ephraim, a son of Joseph, ·was counted [according to their records/lineage]; all the men twenty years old or older who were able to serve in the army were listed by name with their ·families [clans] and family groups.
The tribe of Ephraim totaled 40,500 men.

The ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Manasseh, also a son of Joseph, ·was counted [according to their records/lineage]; all the men twenty years old or older who were able to serve in the army were listed by name with their ·families [clans] and family groups.

The ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Dan ·was counted [according to their records/lineage]; all the men twenty years old or older who were able to serve in the army were listed by name with their ·families [clans] and family groups.

The ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Asher ·was counted [according to their records/lineage]; all the men twenty years old or older who were able to serve in the army were listed by name with their ·families [clans] and family groups.

The ·tribe [sons; descendants] of Naphtali ·was counted [according to their records/lineage]; all the men twenty years old or older who were able to serve in the army were listed by name with their ·families [clans] and family groups.
The tribe of Naphtali totaled 53,400 men.
Moses, Aaron, and the twelve leaders of Israel, one from each of the family groups, counted these men.
Every man of Israel twenty years old or older who was able to serve in the army was counted and listed with his family group.
The total number of men was 603,550.
The families groups from the tribe of Levi were not ·listed [counted] with the others, because
the Lord had told Moses:
“Do not count the tribe of Levi or ·include [take a census of; lift the head of] them with the other Israelites.

Instead put the Levites in charge of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] of the ·Agreement [Treaty; Covenant; Testimony; the Ten Commandments were in the Ark in the Tabernacle; Ex. 25:10] and everything that is with it [Ex. 32:26–29]. They must carry the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] and everything in it, and they must take care of it and make their camp around it.

Any time the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] ·is moved [sets out], the Levites must take it down, and any time it is ·set up [pitched], the Levites must do it. Anyone else who goes near the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] will be put to death.
The ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] will make their camps in separate divisions, each family near its ·flag [standard].

But the Levites must make their camp around the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] of the ·Agreement [Testimony; Treaty; Covenant; 1:50] so that I will not be angry with the ·Israelites [community/ congregation/assembly of the sons/children of Israel]. The Levites will take care of the ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] of the ·Agreement [Testimony; Treaty; Covenant; 1:50].”
So the Israelites did everything just as the Lord commanded Moses.
